member.name: M:C1.Silverlight.C1MaskedTextBox.UpdateValue
member.summary: For Silverlight version of the control, forces to update its and Text properties when the control is not loaded. Does nothing in WPF.
member.remarks:
In Silverlight, when is not loaded yet or not included in a visual tree at all, it doesn't get notifications about the Text property changes and can't update its and Text properties at the proper time therefore, this behavior is inherited from the base TextBox control. If you need to get correct values of these properties while the control is not loaded, call the method after you changed the properties that affect a text formatting, such as , and so on.
This method does nothing when Silverlight version of the control is loaded, as well as in the WPF version of the control at any moment independently of its load state.

member.remarks: Just after the Text property has beed changed via user input or code, the updates the text again in order to make it consistent with the . As a result, the TextChanged event can be triggered twice on each user input. In contrast to this, the is triggered only when Text is updated with a value that conforms to the .

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.C1MaskedTextBox.Mask
member.summary: Gets or sets the input mask.

remarks.para: The mask consists of a string that determines what class of character is acceptable at each input position.
Valid mask characters are:
0 Digit (0-9)
9 Digit or space
# Digit, space, or sign (+/-)
L Letter
? Letter or space
A Letter or digit
a Letter, digit, or space
& Any character
. Localized decimal symbol
, Localized thousand separator
: Localized time separator
/ Localized date separator
Other characters are treated as literals. They are displayed in the control but cannot be edited.
For example, the mask "000-0000" causes the control to accept only digits at every position except the third, which always contains a dash.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.C1MaskedTextBox.ReplaceMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether new characters will be inserted or replace existing ones while you are typing.
member.remarks: Set this property value to true if typing characters should be inserted at an insertion point position; otherwise, set it to false if typing characters should overwrite existing characters at an insertion point position.

member.name: T:C1.Silverlight.C1HyperPanel
member.summary: Arranges child elements in a stack and applies a dynamic zoom effect to the elements near the mouse.

remarks.para: The is similar to a , except is applies a dynamic zoom effect as the user moves the mouse over the panel. Child elements near the mouse appear in their normal size, and elements away from the mouse are scaled down and appear smaller.
Use the and properties to control the intensity of the zoom effect.
Use the property to make elements far from the mouse appear faded.
Use and properties on the child elements to determine how they should be aligned within the .

In order to apply the zooming effect efficiently, the takes over the property of its child elements. If you want to apply your own transforms to the child elements, place them in another panel before adding them to the .
Note that some native Silverlight elements (such as the control) do not always auto-size correctly. You should set the width and height of these elements explicitly before adding them to the .

member.name: M:C1.Silverlight.C1HyperPanel.SetCustomDefaultValues
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of a .

member.name: M:C1.Silverlight.C1HyperPanel.MeasureOverride(System.Windows.Size)
member.summary: Measures the size in layout required for child elements and determines a size for the element.
member.param: The available size that this element can give to child elements. Infinity can be specified as a value to indicate that the element will size to whatever content is available.
member.returns: The size that this element determines it needs during layout, based on its calculations of child element sizes.

member.name: M:C1.Silverlight.C1HyperPanel.ArrangeOverride(System.Windows.Size)
member.summary: Positions child elements and determines a size for the element.
member.param: The final area within the parent that this element should use to arrange itself and its children.
member.returns: The actual size used.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.C1HyperPanel.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the dimension by which child elements are stacked.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.C1HyperPanel.Distribution
member.summary: Gets or sets a value between 0.1 and 1.0 that controls how much zooming should be applied to elements near the center.

remarks.para: Small values increase the zoom effect. Elements far from the mouse appear much smaller than elements near the mouse.
Large values decrease the zoom effect. Elements far from the mouse appear only slightly smaller than elements near the mouse.

You can limit the amount by which elements far from the mouse are zoomed out by setting the .For example, setting to 0.5 prevents any child elements from being reduced to less than half their original size.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.C1HyperPanel.ApplyOpacity
member.summary: Gets or sets a value between zero and one that determines the minimum scale to be applied to elements when they are away from the center.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.C1HyperPanel.Center
member.summary: Gets or sets the center of the as a percentage of the control size.

remarks.para: Elements near the center appear larger than the others.
This value is updated automatically as the mouse moves.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.C1HyperPanel.MinElementScale
member.summary: Gets or sets a value between zero and one that determines the minimum scale to be applied to elements when they are away from the center.

remarks.para: This property is useful when the property is set to small values, and you want to prevent child elements from becoming too small when they are away from the mouse.
For example, setting this property to 0.5 prevents any child elements from being reduced to less than half their original size.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.C1HyperPanel.HorizontalContentAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal alignment of the panel's content.

member.name: P:C1.Silverlight.C1HyperPanel.VerticalContentAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical alignment of the panel's content.

member.name: M:C1.Silverlight.PlatformIndependent.AdjustContentControlTemplate(System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate)
member.summary: [Platform safe] Adjusts, if possible, a ControlTemplate intended for the ContentControl.Template property to make it functional in WPF, and returns a passed template reference. Do nothing in Silverlight, just returns a passed template.
member.remarks:
This method resolves the following WPF specific problem: if a ControlTemplate assigned to the ContentControl.Template property has a not assigned TargetType property then a ContentPresenter element used in the template becomes non-functional. As a result an assignment of some UI to the ContentControl.Content property has no effect.
This method checks the ControlTemplate.TargetType property and assign it with ContentControl type if the property is not assigned yet.
Note that this method works only if the template is not sealed yet, which usually means that it has not been applied somewhere at the moment. If the template is sealed then this method does nothing.

member.name: M:C1.Silverlight.C1DragDropManager.RegisterDropTarget(System.Windows.UIElement,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Registers (or unregisters) an element as a drop target.
member.param: that will act as a drop target.
True to register the element, false to unregister.
member.remarks: The element should not be transparent, or it will not receive any mouse events and thus won't be able to act as a drop target.

member.name: M:C1.Silverlight.C1DragDropManager.RegisterDragSource(System.Windows.UIElement,C1.Silverlight.DragDropEffect,System.Windows.Input.ModifierKeys)
member.summary: Registers a to act as a drag source.
member.param: that will act as a drag source.
that will be supported by the object.
that should be pressed in order for the drag operation to start.

remarks.para: When a is registered as a drag source, the monitors the mouse events for that element and starts drag-drop operations automatically when the user presses the mouse over the element and moves it for a few pixels.
This is a convenience method, it is not strictly required; you could handle the mouse events for the objects you want to use as drag sources and call the method explicitly.

Note that only elements that raise mouse events may be used as automatic drag sources. For example, the and controls consume mouse events internally, so the does not receive any mouse events for these controls. Therefore, they cannot be used as automatic drag sources.

member.name: M:C1.Silverlight.C1DragDropManager.DoDragDrop(System.Windows.UIElement,System.Windows.Input.MouseEventArgs,C1.Silverlight.DragDropEffect)
member.summary: Initiates a drag drop operation using a as a source, supporting a specified .
member.param: that contains the mouse position when the drag operation starts.

remarks.para: The is not strictly required, but is usually available since drag drop operations are initiated by mouse actions. If you don't have a to provide, pass null instead.
The method causes the drag operation to start, then returns immediately. The caller is responsible for monitoring and completing the operation using the , , , and events.
